entries.content: Selling is all about disqualifying, not qualifying. Figure out all the reasons why they *can't* work with you and have them argue why you're wrong.
entries.notes: Forces the prospect to defend their situation against perceived barriers, revealing true objections or lack thereof.

entries.content: Get prospects to rule out all alternative solutions before presenting yours. This isolates your offering as the remaining viable option.
entries.notes: A form of isolation by eliminating competitors and other internal fixes.

entries.content: Don't accept excuses. Challenge prospects to uncover the real reasons behind hesitation or objections.
People buy emotionally, justified intellectually. Your job is to find the compelling emotional reason why they need to act.
entries.notes: Focus on the root cause: the feeling or impact of the problem, not just the logical need.

entries.content: "What is the compelling emotional reason why do you need to do this sir and if you don't how does that make you feel?"
entries.notes: Directly probes for the emotional root cause and the consequence of inaction.

entries.content: If a prospect says no, fire out one last question to see if it's a real no or a failure to communicate the value. If still no, move on.
entries.notes: A quick isolation technique to test the depth of an objection before disengaging.

entries.content: Don't talk about what you do; talk about what you fix. Focus the conversation on the prospect's problems and their symptoms.
entries.notes: Orients the discussion around the prospect's world and potential root causes for seeking a solution.

entries.content: Identify the 3 biggest symptoms your prospects likely suffer from and ask them directly if they recognize any of them.
entries.notes: Proactive discovery using clarifying questions based on common pain points.

entries.content: "So when you say [symptom], what do you mean exactly?"
entries.notes: A clarifying question to get the prospect to elaborate on their problem in their own words, revealing the root cause.

entries.content: Get the prospect to admit they have symptoms of a problem you fix. This is the basis for a conversation about how you can help.
entries.notes: Discovery through confirmation of pain points/symptoms.

entries.content: Know what you fix and how it manifests in the prospect's world. This allows you to ask targeted questions to uncover problems.
entries.notes: Requires deep understanding of the problem space from the prospect's perspective.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
